name: coordinated
content:
coordinated adjective
(WELL ORGANIZED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
effectively organized so that all the parts work well together: The rebel troops have launched a coordinated attack on government soldiers. He described the evacuation as one of the most successful and well co-ordinated he had seen.
If a person is coordinated, they move in a very easy and controlled way, especially when playing sports or dancing: I wasn't a very coordinated child. Their movements are wonderfully co-ordinated.
More examplesFewer examplesWe need a coordinated national literacy strategy.This was a coordinated attempt to destabilize the regime.They found that different departments of the organization were not sufficiently well co-ordinated.It was a smooth and coordinated motion.Some of us are gifted with technical minds, rather than co-ordinated limbs.

coordinated adjective
(WELL MATCHED)
arranged so that the colours, etc. match or look attractive together: colour-coordinated decor The colour scheme of their living room is carefully coordinated.
More examplesFewer examplesThe hockey team wore pleated skirts and colour co-ordinated socks.
